data.title: *Another* Royal Baby Has Arrived (and Yes, This Is the Third Royal Baby Born in the Last Two Weeks)
data.meta_description: Stop the royal presses: Another royal couple has welcomed a baby. On August 6, it was announced that Prince Ludwig and Princess Sophie of Bavaria welcomed a baby boy together. A new image shared on the royal family’s Instagram account shows a stork carrying a blue baby blanket. The caption reveals the name of their first child: Prinz Rupprecht Theodor Maria. “Mother and child are in excellent health, the young family is now enjoying their first days together,” it reads. View this post on Instagr
data.text:
Stop the royal presses: Another royal couple has welcomed a baby.

On August 6, it was announced that Prince Ludwig and Princess Sophie of Bavaria welcomed a baby boy together. A new image shared on the royal family’s Instagram account shows a stork carrying a blue baby blanket.

The caption reveals the name of their first child: Prinz Rupprecht Theodor Maria. “Mother and child are in excellent health, the young family is now enjoying their first days together,” it reads.

According to People, Prince Ludwig is first in line of succession for the House of Wittelsbach. And now, his newborn son is second in line for the throne.

Per House of Names, Prinz Rupprecht originates from the German terms hrōd and berht, which mean “bright” and “fame.” In fact, Rupprecht was a name that also belonged to their late ancestor, Crown Prince Rupprecht, who was the oldest child of Ludwig III and the last crown prince of Bavaria.

This exciting news comes over a year after Prince Ludwig and Sophie tied the knot in May 2023. Sophie-Alexandra, who currently has a Bachelor’s degree in Politics and East European Studies from University College London (UCL) in addition to a Masters in Science from the University of Oxford, married Prince Ludwig at Theatiner Church in Munich, Germany.

Karl-Josef Hildenbrand/picture alliance via Getty Images

On their wedding day, It was reported that Sophie fainted during the church ceremony. “A spokesperson confirmed that Princess Sophie fainted during the wedding this morning. After a drink she was fine again and the ceremony continued,” a royal blogger named ChristinZ wrote on X (formerly Twitter) after it happened.

If you didn’t already know, Prinz Rupprecht Theodor Maria is just one of three royal babies to arrive in the last few weeks. Earlier this month, Crown Prince Hussein and Princess Rajwa welcomed their first baby and shared a gorgeous video of the proud dad holding his little girl in his arms. And back in late July, Prince Ernst August Jr. and Princess Ekaterina of Hanover also welcomed their fourth child and revealed the name of their newborn daughter: Princess Margarita.

Congrats to the happy couple!

Royal Princess’s Growing Baby Bump Is on Full Display During Latest Outing
